page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY:ENNISKILLEN 1
page.content: {ENNISKILLEN or INNISKILLING,}the name of the island,is also the name of a famous Irish regiment.The town was founded in 1608 by Captain William Cole.The old castle,which still remains in part,was a{MAGUIRE } stronghold,but there was no town until the{PROTESTANT PLANTATION.}In 1705 a fire destroyed over 80 houses which were rebuilt.By the{GEORGIAN} } period the town had extended beyond the island.{VICTORIAN}building tended to concentrate to the N.and E.with a workhouse,railway and prison.The{20th {century}has covered the surrounding hillsides with housing estates and added three more bridges with another one planned.The hilly landscape was suitable for defence purposes with the West defended by the"Redoubt"(built 1796 a square fort)and the East by the"Forthill"(built 1689 an earthfort)
